2_16UYTd5pL9rt4hhxQAmfX89QqmjJB58xDx.body:
NEW! You can now generate instant webseeds by uploading .mp4 videos less than 50mb in size to : http://www.kittyseedbox.tk:3000 (if page is unavailable, please be patient.. it's likely undergoing maintenance. but it was tested and works). The link that is generated can then be pasted into the URL/Magnet link form when uploading videos.

Powered using NodeJS.

I will allow up to 10gb worth of uploads to take place. Once the 10gb mark has been reached, any future videos will only be allowed for a period of up to 7 days, after which they will be automatically deleted, to save space and also encourage people to seed.

Webseeds are not to be relied upon, but they will be a great way to light the fire and get your videos out there during the early stages of the site, and also in future for people whose videos may not have reached a desirable level of popularity. It's practically a seedbox.

up!
To-do-list:
- Add a script that only allows videos with at least 1 peer to be displayed.
- Publish Kittify source code so that people can create their own http seedboxes.
- Create a light-weight torrent client using Electron that can serve as an alternative to WebTorrent.desktop while using the least amount of CPU and RAM. 
 
This will be called KatyTorrent. KatyTorrent will be able to negotiate CPU usage with the user by allowing scheduled seeding (e.g. schedule it so it only seeds webtorrent files at night, so it doesn't slow down your PC while you're working!)

1_1M2My6KVbq6UPeE4qpN15LCh2TCitnZsRc.body:
> [micks](#comment_2_1Q6QRh4jgYdYcC91NCgUk74nT9BGuYjajZ): KopyKate is pretty legit, I've been working on a clearnet version quite similar to this that isn't inherently reliant upon the zeronet architecture -- it's got the webRTC built into it, and has webseeds automation as well.  Being actively developed.

Having a decentralized database of magnet links is the reason I decided to work with ZeroNet in the first place. 

All in all, KopyKate is a place where one can stream copyrighted content without repercussions. All the other projects I've seen are kinda gutless and only willing to work with videos under the Creative Commons license. I want a YouTube that is free from copyright restrictions.. where somebody could upload a home video playing with their cats while having Katy Perry as background music .. or do a drum cover of their favourite song using the original instrumental tracks .. without having their videos pulled down, flagged, blocked.

Lack of seeds is caused by lack of popularity. It would certainly be nice for WebTorrent to have BitTorrent support, but then, a lot of video formats that are hosted on torrent sites (e.g. MKV's) aren't capable of web streaming, so that doesn't even solve a quarter of the problem.

ZeroNet needs EXPOSURE! Spread the word.

> [kaffie](#comment_456_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): I meant @mick's 'clearnet version'. Bitchute is the only clearnet site like this that I know of. [...]

It is possible and actually quite simple in theory by running a Ubuntu server with node-js modules (create-torrent, WebTorrent-hybrid, etc.). All you'd need is a user-friendly graphical CSS/HTML interface.

Then again, that is technically no different from having webseeds, as you're still using a server that is running 24/7 to seed a torrent. 

Of course, the advantage of having this WebTorrent seedbox would be that users can seed somebody else's torrents.. without having their own PC's switched on.. so it's not a bad idea. It's certainly easier to shut down one seedbox than it is to shutdown a whole army of them, all across the world.

KittySeedBox sounds like a good name for such a Github project. Then again, my only worry is that webtorrent-hybrid is still a bit buggy. We still desperately need to get WebTorrent.desktop fixed.

> [kaffie](#comment_457_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): This is about what I was imagining. Instead of it being user-user, it'd be seedbox to seedbox.  [...]

Don't worry, I got this lol. Seriously, Node-js is ridiculously easy to use.. it didn't seem that way at first.
 
Keep those ideas coming. I should really consider you a crew member at this point.. people get paid to test software, after all.

> [kaffie](#comment_458_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): I just wanna see this stuff thrive, and support pretty much all the efforts to do that. KopyKate is great, really. I should probably start mirroring some more content.

btw - I've just tried seeding with the Vuze torrent client, and it seems to work pretty well without hogging the CPU. Try downloading Vuze (www.vuze.com) and seeding a video I just uploaded called In The Mood. I want to see what speeds it will yield with 2 peers. Note that it could take up to 1 minute to discover the first peer.

1_18C45ndJpnDbtgU7QdFxbfcENxBsPPEUtG.body: dunno man. all I can say is world politics has become depressing. our Big Brothers got what they wanted - they successfully pitted us peasants against each other, so as to weaken us and make us easier to control.

The thing is, though. 2016 was not about Capitalism vs. Socialism. It was about Right wing populism vs. Left wing populism. Both groups are supported by low-income people who lack job opportunities and hate the system. The right blames unemployment on immigration and lazy minorities, but nonetheless wants to use the power of Taxation to increase military spending and build trillion-dollar border walls. The left blames unemployment and poverty on big corporations and wall street.

Both groups are just as whiny and entitled as each other, it's not about free markets or anything, but a lot of an-caps ironically happen to be Trump supporters .. not realizing that you need government and taxation to enforce borders.

I personally support free markets, but we are going to need a Universal Basic Income so as to provide a floor for people to stand on, and make homelessness, poverty, welfare dependency, etc. a thing of the past, just like we rendered starvation a thing of the past with the power of agriculture and food processing technology.

You can be pro-free markets and anti-poverty. Communism is about seizing the means of production. This discourages entrepreneurship, and punishes that little girl wanting to set up a lemonade stand to make some extra cash for her family, more than it punishes the wolf of wall street. However, a free market economy coupled with a universal basic income means people would be free to take risks and be more willing to experiment with startups and small businesses because they wouldn't be worried about eviction or homelessness or anything. It also rewards people who work because they would be able to combine their paychecks with this guaranteed stipend. We already live in a kind of gig economy. It used to be that you could get a job at a factory and stay there for 20 years. 

Those days are gone, robots have taken over.. you're more likely to spend your 20's doing 100 different jobs and going from one place to the next. People here in New Zealand go to the welfare office about as often as they go to the doctor. There's still stigma.. but I believe getting rid of the Welfare system and replacing it with UBI would get rid of this stigma and the US vs. them mentality, because everybody would be receiving this survival allowance.

I mean, this whole self-made man mythos is a load of crap. You'd be nothing living on a deserted island. We are a civilization, and we depend on one another.
There's just as many drug addicted rich brats living off their daddy's cash who aren't homeless.
